main event: On 21 April 1957 in Albuquerque, New Mexico, an object, circular in shape and the size of a pea, silver in color and bright, was observed moving south at a 45-degree angle, then diving downward and moving north at a 5-degree angle to the horizon.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 5 minutes, and the object was seen moving in a very specific path with changes in direction and angle.
The report mentions that preparing officers thought the sighting was of a balloon, but the height and speed of the sighting at the time indicated otherwise.
The observer was driving a car and noticed the object over mountains in front of them, indicating a ground-visual observation.

The document includes details about the weather and winds-aloft during the sighting, as well as the release of a balloon by the US Weather Bureau, which is considered the best explanation for the sighting.
The report was submitted as required by AFR 200-2, indicating the official nature of the investigation.
sighted object: one circular object, the size of a pea, bright and silver in color
